No one who compares the phraseology of ‘this passage with that of the quotation from Manetti’s Vita Dantis given above can have much doubt that this was the source from which Manetti's account of the letter was derived. This passage also proves, what Zenatti doubted, that, whether or no Manetti had a first-hand acquaintance with the letter, Bruni certainly had. Manetti’s acquisition of the MS. containing the letter must have been subsequent to the compilation of his Vita Dantis, otherwise he would surely have utilized it for the purposes of his work.
